metadata.title: CVE-2024-1151 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Open vSwitch sub-component in the LinuxKernel. The flaw occurs when a recursive operation of code push recursivelycalls into the code block. The OVS module does not validate the stackdepth, pushing too many frames and causing a stack overflow. As a result,this can lead to a crash or other related issues.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-1151` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1004-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10

Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
